intro: Ptisana decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive ptisana, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Ptisana decipiens is noted for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its resilience to coastal winds and salt spray.
